QuestionText: A Credit Limit defines the maximum amount of credit assigned to a B2B unit, and if an order exceeds the credit limit, the account manager of the B2B Unit needs to approve it. What should you pay attention to when you are managing a credit limit? (2 correct)

Options.question: 1.) A date range must be defined, either as a range with start and end date (e.g. 01.Jan-30.June) or periodic (e.g. weekly), or both (weekly from 01.Jan-30.June)
2.) An alert threshold (as a percentage value, e.g. 80% or absolute value in currency, e.g. 4,000 USD) must be defined
3.) A threshold value must be defined in a given currency, (5,000 USD, for example).
4.) One or more B2B units can be assigned to the same credit limit (e.g. Store East and Store West use the same weekly credit limit)

QuestionText: A customer wants to create promotional coupons for a marketing campaign. The coupons should be valid only for one use. How can you implement this in SAP Commerce?

2.) Generate a multi-code coupon in the BackOffice Customer Support Cockpit
3.) Generate a single-code coupon in the BackOffice Administration Cockpit
4.) Generate a single-code coupon in the BackOffice Customer Support Cockpit

QuestionText: For which use case is a product variant appropriate?

QuestionText: How does SAP Commerce arrange its product and category data?

Options.question: 1.) All categories must have at least one supercategory
2.) A product is duplicated when it is associated with a new category
3.) Categories can contain other categories and/or products
4.) Each product must be associated with only one category

QuestionText: How does SAP Commerce Cloud handle shopping carts? (2 correct)

3.) Carts can be exported and imported using the Comma-Separated Values (CSV) format

QuestionText: How does the concept of categorization work in SAP Commerce? (2 correct)

3.) A category can contain a set of product attributes

2.) One staged catalog version and one online catalog version
3.) One staged catalog version and multiple online catalog versions
4.) Multiple staged catalog versions and one online catalog version

QuestionText: In Media Management of SAP Commerce Cloud, media format is an important concept. What is it typically used for? (2 correct)

Options.question: 1.) A media format contains a reference to the physical file, according to which the media is converted.
2.) A media asset is displayed with the exact size information, which is stored in the media format.
3.) A media format can store information needed to perform conversion on the assigned media.
4.) A media asset is displayed regardless of the size information, which is stored in the media format.

QuestionText: In Order Management Services module, what are the functionalities of Sourcing Allocation? (2 correct)

3.) Allocation Service allows reallocation of items from a consignment to another warehouse
